title: Associate Store Manager - Bridgewater Commons Mall - Bridgewater, NJ
description:
**Looking for a job to get you out of bed?**
--------------------------------------------



At Casper, our mission is to awaken the potential of a well-rested world. We believe that better sleep makes for better living. We design products and experiences to help you dream your way to a better life!



Casper's Retail story began in 2017 with The Casper Wake-Up. Alongside its success, Casper opened 15 pop-up shops across the U.S. After an exciting beginning with Retail, Casper opened its first permanent store in NYC in 2018, we've reached over 70 retail locations and are growing!



We are deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce so that we represent all those who dream big equally.


**Nuts and Bolts:**
-------------------



We are looking for a naturally charismatic leader with exceptional service and sales acumen to be an Associate Store Manager. You will oversee staff and day-to-day operations alongside the Store Manager. You will help benchmark Casper's offline experience by nurturing a customer-centric and consultative sales culture. You are passionate about people management and recognize that getting the best from your team requires leading by example, active coaching and investing in their development. You have a practical sensibility when it comes to customer journey and excel in data-driven decision making.


**The Customer**
----------------


* Create an engaging customer experience that focuses on building relationships through the connection and relation of our brand and brand values.
* Evangelize the Casper mission of sleep and increase customer awareness.
* Protect and enhance the Casper omni channel customer journey.
* Be the voice of the customer, ensuring insights and opportunities to improve brand, product and services are communicated back to the Casper organization.
* Responsible for meeting/exceeding sales plans and increasing Casper's market penetration rate.

**The Team**
------------


* Assume managerial duties in the absence of the manager, including staff scheduling, opening/closing, inventory management, upholding visual brand standards, maintaining safe working conditions and facilities maintenance.
* Recruit, retain and develop a unique talent pool through continuous daily networking and interviewing prospective candidates.
* Develop, coach, and mentor a world class service-minded and high performing team.
* Foster an inspiring environment of engagement and learning, empowering team members to realize their full potential.
* Maintain performance culture of ownership, continuous improvement and goal achievement.
* Implement and supervise ongoing training and feedback with the team.
* Work with the fleet to build out back of house processes and manage continuous improvements.

**Our dream candidate has...**
------------------------------


* 3+ years minimum experience as a people leader in Retail, sales, customer service or hospitality industry.
* Exceptional leadership capabilities with a track record of attracting, developing, and motivating top talent, swiftly adapting to change, and leading others through the fast paced environments
* Financial management experience with success in driving top-line sales, interpreting reporting data, managing payroll budgets, and controlling expenses.
* Deep and demonstrated understanding of service excellence in a consumer environment.
* Excellent communication skills with a knack for building consensus via influence.
* The desire to work in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment – understands the importance of experimentation and iteration.
* Willing to relocate for growth opportunities
* Fluency in Salesforce preferred
* Must be able to lift at least 50lbs
* Hours expectation: minimum of 40 hours per week including weekends, based on business needs
* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent

**The syrup on your waffles**
-----------------------------


* Employee Discount to use on whatever you like! (with a few exceptions)
* Salary to pay your bills and a potential bonus for some splurging
* Gifted Bedding after tenure milestones
* Medical, vision, and dental insurance to help you with those coughs or cavities (too many waffles...)
* Paid Time Off
* Incentivized Referral Program


If you dream about this stuff this job is probably right for you. We look forward to learning more about you!

title: Research Technician – Single Cell and Spatial Biology
description:
Are you interested in making an impact on disease research and medicine using the **hottest single-cell omics technologies** – the 2019 Nature Method of the Year and **spatial transcriptomics** – the 2020 Nature Method of the Year? Singulomics wants to hear from you.

**Job Title:** Research Technician – Single Cell Biology and Molecular Genetics

**About the company:**

Singulomics, established in New York in 2016, is a fast-growing biotechnology company that aims to transform single-cell omics research and unlock its many applications in biology and medicine. Singulomic’s founders are at the forefront of single-cell omics research and commercialization. Building on the unmatched expertise in single-cell genomics, transcriptomics, and epigenomics developed since the mid-2000s at Albert Einstein College of Medicine, we develop and provide high-quality, innovative single-cell services to academic and industrial communities worldwide. In addition, our end-to-end single-cell solutions enable global biopharmaceutical companies to accelerate target discovery and biomarker development. The company is located on the Albert Einstein campus in Bronx, NY.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

- Provide state-of-the-art laboratory services to clients according to Standard Operating Procedures

- Assist supervisor in testing and implementing new technologies and services in single-cell and spatial omics/biology

- Order and manage supplies

- Communicate with industrial and academic clients (scientists) and suppliers

- Excellent training opportunities for the latest technologies

**Job Requirements:**

- Requires a minimum of a bachelor's degree in Biological Sciences

- Advanced degree in Biological Sciences a plus

- Requires a minimum of 2-year lab experience (Molecular Genetics or Single Cell Biology preferred)

- 10x Genomics single-cell and/or spatial transcriptomics experience highly desirable

- Sequencing-related lab experience a plus

- Histology experience (tissue sectioning for frozen and FFPE tissues) highly desirable

- Requires American citizenship or with working permit in the US

- Ability to multitask in a rapidly-growing, fast-paced environment

- Desire to quickly learn new skills and adapt to new challenges

- Good communication skills

Competitive salary and benefits (health insurance, paid time off, 401k).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* When will you be able to start the position?
* What is your college GPA?
* Are you authorized to work lawfully in the United States?
* Where are you located now?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* laboratory: 2 years (Required)
* frozen tissue sectioning: 1 year (Preferred)
* FFPE tissue sectioning: 1 year (Preferred)
* 10x Visium Spatial: 1 year (Preferred)
* library preparation: 1 year (Preferred)
* RNA extraction: 1 year (Preferred)
* lab management: 1 year (Preferred)
* Illumina sequencing: 1 year (Preferred)
* 10x genomics chromium: 1 year (Preferred)

title: Corporate IT Manager
description:
**Conductor** is a leading Website Optimization & Intelligence platform. Today's top brands use Conductor to create and optimize digital experiences that get found organically in search engines and drive value for customers. The platform provides actionable SEO, content, and technical website intelligence paired with real-time website monitoring to help customers accelerate—and protect—digital growth.


**Conductor** is a mission-driven company with a commitment to innovation, customer success, and culture. For Conductor, success is improving the lives of all the people in our orbit—our customers, our customers' customers, our employee-owners, and our communities.


**The IT Manager** will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of our IT and computer systems, supporting our teams across our three office locations (NYC, Germany, and Czech Republic), as well as remote global employees. You'll lead a small team responsible for supporting global end users, managing our network, and maintaining critical enterprise applications such as Google Workspace, Slack, and Zoom. Reporting directly to the Chief People Officer, this hands-on role involves managing IT staff, developing and implementing IT policies and procedures, and collaborating with other departments to meet organizational goals.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Supervise and lead the IT Team, including hiring, training, and performance evaluations.
* Oversee the maintenance, upgrade, and administration of all IT systems, including **networks, servers, databases, and software applications.**
* Maintain network security and ensure data privacy and security standards, working closely with our Information Security Team.
* Develop and implement IT strategies aligned with company goals.
* Provide comprehensive IT support, including provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of hardware and software.
* Ensure the availability and reliability of IT systems through proactive monitoring and maintenance.
* Manage desktop support globally, assigning work, setting priorities, and identifying opportunities for process improvement.
* Oversee vendor relationships and negotiate contracts.
* Collaborate with senior management to align IT initiatives with business objectives.
* Identify and recommend new technologies to improve business processes.
* Ensure employees have necessary technology tools (e.g., laptops, software).
* Implement and manage data storage solutions, including cloud storage.
* Monitor and maintain hardware and software systems, including servers, networks, and databases.
* Ensure IT project completion on time and within budget.
* Document and maintain internal processes and procedures SOPs
* Ensure adherence to IT best practices and support compliance audits.
* Manage critical apps and communication systems, including email, instant messaging, and video conferencing.
* Provide user training and support.
* Be on call to manage critical issues outside normal work hours.
* Coordinate the purchase, installation, and maintenance of desktop equipment, printers, and mobile devices while also maintaining inventory of assets.
* Develop and manage the IT budget, ensuring cost-effective solutions.
* Provide technical support and guidance to IT staff and end-users.
* Appropriately Handle sensitive and privileged company information.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in technology, computer science, or equivalent experience.
* **8+ years** of experience supporting hardware and software in an enterprise environment.
* At least **2 years of demonstrated supervisory experience**.
* Strong knowledge of IT infrastructure, systems, and best practices.
* Advanced experience with network administration, cybersecurity, and data management.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., PMP, ITIL, CISSP) are a plus.
* Excellent leadership, organizational, and communication skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and decision-making skills.
* Great project management skills, including organization, planning, time management, and prioritization.
* High level of integrity, professionalism, and service orientation.
* Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong interpersonal and team management skills.
* Availability for on-call support during critical incidents or emergencies.
* Willingness to travel occasionally to other company sites or for professional development.


This is a full-time, in-office role **(4 days a week in the office, work from anywhere 1 day a week)** based at our corporate offices in New York City.



-


**Compensation:** Conductor maintains competitive, performance-based compensation programs.


**The NYC base salary range for this role is currently $80,000- 115,000.** Actual base salary offered may vary within this range based on education, knowledge, skills, abilities, relevant experience, internal equity, and geographic location, among other factors. The actual compensation, if offered a position, will be based on these factors.


**Variable compensation:** In addition to the base salary, this role is also eligible for an annual **Corporate Bonus of 10%** tied to company and individual performance**.**



-



Conductor LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Bringing in diverse perspectives and challenging our assumptions is the clear key to growth; it drives innovation, creativity, faster problem-solving, and stronger decision making. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, train, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs*.*



Conductor does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. In addition, it is the policy of Conductor to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances where a particular employee works.

title: Community Programs Coordinator
description:
Asphalt Greens Community Programs Department is looking to hire a Coordinator to focus on our highly successful Recess Enhancement Program (REP). The program operates in 60 schools across the city with a goal of getting NYC school children (PK 5th grade) active through fun, safe, and inclusive games. Each year the AG team of coaches and full time staff help ensure that over 25,000 NYC school children get the benefits of physically active play during the school day!


Are you passionate about promoting play and physical health among NYCs children? This is a rare opportunity to join our REP team as a Community Programs Coordinator! Reporting to the REP Manager, our team of CP Coordinators provide supervision, support, and guidance to part time REP coaches who implement the program at participating schools.


Asphalt Green (AG) is a nonprofit organization that transforms lives through sports, fitness, and play for all. AG operates two world class facilities in Manhattan and runs Community Programs throughout NYC. Asphalt Green offers a diverse range of services that cater to individuals of all ages, abilities, and backgrounds. See www.asphaltgreen.org for more information on who we are.

**Responsibilities**

* **Recess Enhancement Program**
	+ Provide administrative and on-site supervisory support across 10-12 REP sites (elementary schools city-wide).
	+ Act as a supervisor and mentor to 10-12 play coaches to ensure the programs success.
	+ Contribute to development and implementation of program materials and curricula.
	+ Identify, report, and address programmatic issues.
* **Staffing**
	+ Assist with recruiting, interviewing and hiring part time stafffor REP
	+ Support program staff in carrying out their functions and meeting their goals  
	
	(e.g. senior play coaches are making effective use of their site visits to supervise and mentor play coaches)
	+ Model and promote appropriate behavior and program delivery for staff.
	+ Ensure staff arrive on time and work full shifts and that hours are recorded and accounted for accurately.
* **Equipment and supplies**
	+ Ensure equipment and supplies are properly stored and distributed.
	+ Maintain departmental inventory.
* **Participation**
	+ Conduct outreach and promotion as needed.
	+ Ensure participant registration is completed accurately.
	+ Ensure program attendance and other outcomes measurements are captured according to established procedures; including capturing and communicating success stories.

* Bachelor's Degree preferred.
* Minimum of 2-3 years of applicable professional experience which includes:
	+ Supervision of full-time and/or part-time staff.
	+ Work in a youth service organization.
	+ Work within large, urban public school system.
	+ Experience with program and staff development and evaluation.
* Strong personal interest in play, sports, and/or fitness.
* Strong leadership, time management, and multitasking skills.
* Ability to work independently.

title: FORKLIFT DRIVER
description:
Do you love candy and snacks? Are you looking to join an ever evolving and rapidly growing team? PIM Brands might just be exactly what youre looking for!


At PIM, we make the brands you love. Our portfolio of products, from Welchs Fruit Snacks to Sun-Maid Chocolate Raisins and Sour Jacks Sour Candies are enjoyed by millions of consumers every day. And when it comes to careers, we seek talented, results-oriented individuals who want to play a part in building amazing brands and products while working in a collaborative, dynamic, and fast-paced office environment. At PIM, you can make an immediate and lasting contribution to help grow iconic snack and confectionery brands, no matter your area of expertise.


We are looking for a **Forklift Driver** interested in starting a SWEET career as part of our Warehouse team at PIMs Somerset, NJ Locations.

**JOB OVERVIEW**


Responsible for operating all department equipment including all forklifts, pick up truck and box truck. Coordinates material transfers between Pierce and Cottontail warehouses. Maybe based in either.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Unload inbound shipments safely and move product to storage locations
* Efficiently stack and store the merchandise in the appropriate areas.
* Report food safety and quality issues to Plant management and SQFP
* Follow PIM Brands GMP rules
* Monitor fellow employees for adherence to GMPs.
* Inventory evaluations, cycle counting and monitoring inventory
* Ensure inbound and outbound shipments are accurate and free of damage. Report quality variances
* Order Picking: Pull and prepare product for shipment, ensuring that the exact number and type of product is loaded and shipped. Perform picking duties in an efficient manner
* Loading**:** Efficiently move product from staging and/or storage areas into trailers
* Coordinates all warehouse material management consisting of raw material and packaging.
* Schedules work assignments and projects to all warehouse shifts.
* Prepares, coordinates and delivers materials to Pierce. Complete all related paperwork for accurate tracking of material movement.
* Performs system transfers of materials and put-aways
* Receiving of materials and non-consumables and entered into the system
* Enforces the implementation of workplace policies and procedures
* Promotes and exhibits safe work behaviors
* Performs other duties as required.
* Ability to work additional hours as needed

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS/ ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**




Demands include standing, walking, sitting, bending, reaching, kneeling and crouching; manual dexterity of hands and fingers to handle or feel objects, tools and controls. Reasonable accommodations will be evaluated and considered to enable an individual to perform the essential job functions.




**WORK ENVIRONMENT**




Job will generally be performed in the manufacturing plant. When on the plant floor it is representative of a large, busy manufacturing operation. Noisy, active, objects on the floor, constant movement and traffic flow of motorized equipment. Hair net, beard net, assigned work uniform, protective eye wear and gloves are among the GMP required apparel that must be worn, if indicated, on the plant floor.


**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING**

* High School education or equivalent work experience is strongly preferred
* Possess clean driving record and Forklift license in good standing
* Strong organization and coordination skills
* Able to read and write English
* Attentive to detail
* Forklift Certified
* Good communication and interpersonal skills
* RF Scan Gun experience
* Must be available to work weekends
* CDL license a Plus


PIM Brands is an Equal Opportunity Employer. PIM Brands is an E-Verfiy Employer

title: Mold Inspector Exp. REQ.-Regular travel required
description:
**Hiring immediately**

**Mold Inspector**

**\\* Job Pay based on experience/license**

**RTK Environmental Group** is seeking a **Mold Inspector** to cover a territory consisting primarily of Westchester, Putnam, Dutchess Counties, NY., Fairfield County, CT and New York City. This is a full-time, position that consists of both field and remote work.

As a **Mold Inspector** you will interface with our clients in their homes and businesses, providing inspections for mold and possibly lead and/or asbestos if qualified. We cater to both new and repeat clients who know us by our high standard of professionalism.

**About RTK Environmental Group:**

We are an environmental testing firm in business for over 25 years. We service the NYC Tri-State area including Connecticut, Northern New Jersey, Long Island, Westchester, Putnam and Rockland Counties. Our team consists of field inspectors, office staff and the management team. We are known in the industry for providing timely, professional and expert services in homes, apartment buildings and businesses.

**Prospective Candidates** should meet the following qualifications:

* Our ideal candidate holds a current New York **Mold Assessor** license and/or **Asbestos Inspector, Lead Inspector** license. Related experience or certification in another environmental testing discipline is a plus.
* Must be based around Westchester County, NY or nearby to service the areas above.
* Must be able to communicate effectively with clientele, including homeowners, management companies, insurance adjusters, remediation contractors, and realtors related to projects.
* Must maintain an upbeat attitude and stay motivated to help represent RTK to our clients. Our inspectors are the face of the company, so positivity is key!
* Must be able to work independently and complete reports in a timely manner.
* Able to work with a small team and assist with ongoing operations as required. This includes in-person, over-the-phone and email correspondence.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook) and report writing required. You will be asked for a writing sample.
* Must be a trustworthy individual who is capable of following a schedule, with the ability to handle changes with limited notice.
* This position requires daily driving. A clean driving record and background check are required.
* Company vehicle is provided for use during work hours.

title: Project Manager - Construction
description:
**Job Summary:** RailPros is seeking a seasoned Force Account Manager to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a critical part in major rail projects by developing and implementing track outage and force account staffing strategies. Your focus will be on ensuring safe and productive work windows for complex projects on or near live tracks. You will engage with a diverse group of stakeholders, including project owners, management teams, construction managers, contractors, and railroad safety personnel to coordinate efforts and resolve challenges.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and manage track outage and force account staffing strategies for major rail projects.
* Coordinate with project leaders and stakeholders to ensure safety and productivity.
* Interact regularly with project owners, management teams, contractors, and railroad personnel.
* Monitor and track outage and force account plans against actual performance.
* Create solutions for scheduling and managing force account resources under complex conditions.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs):**

* **Operating Rules:** Qualified, previously qualified, or ability to re-qualify on the General Code of Operating Rules (GCOR) and/or the Northeast Operating Rules Advisory Committee (NORAC).
* **Safety Requirements:** Ability to pass all Host Railroad safety requirements (RWP).
* **Railroad Knowledge:** In-depth understanding of specific railroad operating rules, policies, and procedures for outage planning and force account management.
* **Site Characteristics:** Ability to learn and teach others the railroad Physical Characteristics of each project site.
* **Collective Bargaining Agreements:** Experience with or knowledge of applying/interpreting railroad collective bargaining agreements.
* **Communication:** Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* **Performance Tracking:** Proficient in monitoring, tracking, and recording outage and force account plans.
* **Collaboration:** Effective in collaborating with diverse project stakeholders and finding solutions to daily challenges.
* **Problem-Solving:** Ability to craft effective outage and force account solutions under challenging conditions, including tight schedules, budgets, and multiple operators.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelors Degree in Construction Management or a related engineering discipline preferred.
* **Experience:** 10+ years of experience supporting major complex capital projects on live rail can be considered in lieu of a degree.
* **Railroad Experience:** Extensive senior-level experience in maintenance of way, capital program delivery, and force account labor management.
* **Project Management:** Proven experience in assisting with project phasing, sequencing, and work-task bundling to optimize work windows and resource use.

**Why RailPros?**

* **Innovative Projects:** Engage in cutting-edge rail projects and make a significant impact on the industry.
* **Collaborative Culture:** Work with a team of experts dedicated to excellence and safety.
* **Career Growth:** Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
* **Commitment to Safety:** Be part of an organization that prioritizes safety and quality in all operations.

**Full Benefits:**

* Competitive salary
* Comprehensive health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
* Retirement savings plan with company match
* Paid time off (PTO) and holidays
* Professional development opportunities

**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):**

* **Project Efficiency:** Timeliness and effectiveness of track outage and force account staffing strategies.
* **Stakeholder Satisfaction:** Feedback from project leaders, contractors, and railroad personnel.
* **Safety Compliance:** Adherence to safety protocols and regulations.
* **Budget Adherence:** Effective management of resources within budget constraints.
* **Performance Tracking:** Accuracy and effectiveness in monitoring and recording project performance.

**Travel Requirements:**

* Regular travel to project sites within the Northeast region.


If you meet these qualifications and are ready to advance your career with RailPros, we encourage you to apply today. Join us in delivering excellence in the rail industry!

title: Program Operations Associate
description:
**Are you ready to directly impact the lives of first-generation college students and champion economic mobility for all?**

**About Us**


Did you know that only 21% of low income, first-generation college students in the U.S. graduate within six years? Those who do graduate have a median household income 27% lower than their peers. While there are a multitude of college access programs for high school seniors and job assistance programs for low-wage earners, there are few programs that ensure first-generation students stay in school and build the skills necessary to prepare for long-term careers. This is where America Needs You (ANY) comes in.


ANY fights for economic mobility for ambitious, first-generation college students by providing transformative mentorship and intensive career development. Founded in 2009 and headquartered in New York City, ANY expanded to New Jersey in 2012, Illinois in 2015, and California in 2016, growing from serving 50 students to nearly 600 students annually. In 2021, ANY launched FirstGenU, a new virtual program designed to help 10,000 first-generation college students navigate their careers. Visit https://americaneedsyou.org/firstgenu/ to learn more.

**Position Description**


ANY is currently seeking a dedicated and organized Program Operations Associate to support the National Program Director in the implementation of our Fellows Program in NY/NJ/IL. This position provides critical day-to-day administration and project management to all components of the national program operations including internships, transfer, partnerships, and new e-learning initiatives. The Program Operations Associate reports directly to ANY’s National Program Director and supports the national program operations team.

**We Offer:**

* A warm, collaborative work environment with a rich culture of support and feedback
* A generous benefits package (health/dental insurance, 403(b), FSA, three weeks vacation, etc.)
* Ongoing internal and external opportunities for professional development
* Connections to a large, high-powered professional network

 **Our Ideal Candidate:**

* Is committed to ANY’s mission of supporting ambitious, first-generation college students
* Is excited about supporting a large program operation hands-on
* Is passionate about project management and operational efficiency
* Connections to a large, high-powered professional network

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide day-to-day assistance to the national program operations team and directly support the National Program Director to deliver ANY’s Fellows program in three states
* Streamline and manage the internship database and its structure, including national partnership-sourced internships
* Track national partner opportunities and monitor national partner dashboards; track and remind local sites about upcoming internship deadlines, and report on their progress to ensure applications
* Review qualifications/requirements against ANY Fellow qualifications and ensure we share accurate information and relevant opportunities with our sites serving Fellows
* Use a national dashboard to track, report, and support internship outcomes monthly, to help teams make data-driven decisions about internship support and case management
* Manage Internship Support calendar and co-lead Case Support Training meetings
* Manage Fellow professional development grant distribution, including creating and distributing Salesforce reports, training staff on policies and procedures, and troubleshooting questions from staff and Fellows
* Support the revision and creation of all internship outcome protocols and templates
* Provide day-to-day support to and administer ANY’s Learning Management System – Canvas
* Assist in the preparation and presentation of program-related information and updates to staff during monthly program meetings
* Coordinate all career day logistics and collaborate with relevant staff to lead the content and run of the day for the event
* Support ANY’s new FirstGenU program by providing administrative support in all aspects of the program
* Prepare materials and communication for FirstGenU partnership meetings, support enrollment, and conduct participant/data tracking
* Other duties as determined by ANY

 **Qualifications:**

* Between 1-3 years of experience, preferably in career counseling or a related field
* Bachelor’s Degree required
* Strong project management skills and prior experience preferred
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment
* Highly developed verbal and written communication skills
* Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills
* Microsoft Office proficiency

 **To Apply:**


Please apply here and submit a cover letter and a resume. Please note that your application will not be considered without a cover letter. No phone calls, please.


Salary is in the low $50k range, commensurate with experience.

title: Stock Supervisor
description:
Our Story
We’re J.Crew Factory, and we believe shopping should be fun. Our brand is built on creating timeless styles that last season after season—while still making sure to stay in front of what’s next. We also believe in looking like a million bucks, not spending it, which is why we go the extra mile to source the best fabrics at the most accessible prices. We also know that we have a responsibility to the planet and to humanity to choose eco-friendly fabrics and to support our factory workers, without compromise. We aim to cultivate high-quality employees so together, as a team, we can mirror our brand values: creativity, inclusion and collaboration. If this sounds like you, we want to talk. At J.Crew Factory, there are no strangers, only friends you haven’t met yet.
Job Summary
As a Stock Supervisor, you’ll oversee Back of House operations functions: receiving, shipping, inventory management, stockroom organization and standards and markdown/markup execution. You’ll be responsible for efficiently receiving product, making sure it’s quickly replenished on the sales floor and tidy and easily accessible in the stock room. You’ll package orders for our customers – quickly but with care and will help with tasks as needed. You’ll contribute to an inclusive work environment focused on collaboration and passion for both the product and providing our customers with an amazing experience.
Job Responsibilities* Own the stock room and ensure that the right people are in the right place at the right time.
* Show leadership capability and provide direction to stock associates.
* Comply with merchandise receiving and handling guidelines.
* Ensure store meets visual, replenishment, cleanliness, safety and back of house standards.
* Have excellent communication skills with Inventory Control, the management team, and associates.
* Achieve or exceed task-specific time standards.
* Mange supply inventory, repairs, maintenance and equipment.
* Read reporting for incoming shipments and expand or contract back of house space based on ownership.
* Maintain presentation standards.
* Learn our systems and processes and use them effectively.
* Act in a manner that aligns with our values.
* Perform projects and tasks assigned by the management team.


(About you) You’ll be great in the role if you …* Are a team player and bring your best to everything you do.
* Are flexible, and ready to have fun along the way.
* Leverage technology to maximize efficiency and productivity.
* Are at least 18 years old.
* Are available when we are busy, including: nights, weekends and holidays.
* Can bend, reach, stretch as well as lift, carry and move at least 40 pounds | 18 kilos.
* Can regularly move around all store areas and be accessible to customers.


Before we wrap, a word about a few of our way cool perks…* Competitive base pay and bonus programs
* Flexible days and hours
* Amazing merchandise discounts
* 24/7 free confidential help with a variety of personal and work concerns
* Personal and professional development
* Giving back –volunteer program, disaster relief funds, charitable matching donations\\*
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, pet insurance, legal plan, ID theft, commuter benefit\\*
* Time Away – paid time off, holidays, parental leave, disability leave, bereavement\\*
* 401(k) plan with company matching contributions\\*

* Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to work location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.


Hourly Range: $20.00 - $30.00
At J.Crew Group (JCG) we aim to pay competitively for our company’s size and industry. The base salary offered will take into account internal equity and may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region of work premises, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The base salary is just one component of J.Crew Group’s competitive total rewards strategy that also includes the opportunity for bonus, competitive benefits and perks.
One of our core focuses here at JCG is creating a community and culture that builds belonging. We are deeply committed to our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion efforts, and we warmly welcome job applicants of all backgrounds.  

JCG is proud to affirmatively provide equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or citizenship, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, legally protected physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected under applicable law.

title: Head Sports Coach
description:

**You will earn $42,000 per year and enjoy weekly pay, health benefits and our referral program.** 

**To qualify for these coaching positions, you must have a basic knowledge of sports and a** **Personal Trainer Certificate. In addition, you must have:**

* Strong computer skills and know how to use office equipment.
* The ability to work afternoons and weekends to accommodate sporting events and practices.
* The ability to lift 20 pounds.
* A valid driver’s license and be able to drive a 15-passenger van.
* A high school diploma or GED. A college degree is preferred, but not required.
* A CPR/First Aid certification.
* Prior experience is preferred.

**If you have a passion for sports and a drive to make a difference, we want to hear from you! Apply today for immediate consideration.** 

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 per year

* Health insurance

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

title: Assistant Manager
description:
Our Story
We make timeless clothes that last a lifetime…then pair them with of-the-moment styles season after season, decade after decade. We think that distinct heritage pairs perfectly with modern design and fabric technology. We believe in feel-good color… Even if black or navy makes you feel best, we’re here for that. We’re the experts in signature categories: cashmere, coats, blazers, pants—and we also collaborate with the coolest brands out there because we know that creativity is contagious. We consider leopard a neutral, speak stripes fluently and live for a great gingham. We believe in looking like a million bucks, not spending it—which is why we go the extra mile to source the absolute best fabrics at the most accessible prices. We also know that we have a responsibility to the planet and to humanity to choose eco-friendly fabrics and to support our factory workers, without compromise.
Job Summary
As an Assistant Manager, you are a key member of the leadership team. You’re responsible for supporting a profitable business-focusing on creating genuine connections that foster customer loyalty, love of the brand, and strong community engagement. You’re responsible for providing in-the-moment feedback and coaching so each team member can contribute at their highest potential. You’ll partner with your leadership team to make adjustments when needed to drive the business forward, while seamlessly stepping in on tasks when needed.
Job Responsibilities* Be the role model for creating personalized connections with customers that drive loyalty and excitement for the brand.
* Observe associate performance on the selling floor and assist if necessary to make a connection or sale.
* Lead fit sessions that enhance product knowledge and fuel a style obsession.
* Help associates make the most of each customer interaction by sharing specific actions to improve outcomes.
* Ensure the team is always on track to make their goals and exceed customer expectations.
* Own the selling floor and ensure that the right people are in the right place at the right time.
* Be ready to step in for another manager as needed.
* Plan and execute local events that tie to the community and fuel incremental traffic and sales.
* Act in a manner that aligns with our values.


(About you) You’ll be great in the role if you …* Love our brand, customers and teams.
* Have a great fashion aesthetic and are plugged in to what’s happening in the industry and community.
* Have a track record of setting and achieving goals.
* Are energized by change; shift gears quickly and rally the team behind new strategies and projects.
* Make smart decisions by: actively listening, understanding data and looking beyond the obvious.
* Have a high school diploma or equivalent combo of education and experience.
* Have 2 or more years of experience with similar scope, specialty retail preferred.
* Communicate effectively and confidently.
* Process information and operate store systems accurately.
* Are available when we are busy, including: nights, weekends and holidays.
* Are adept with technology and apps and familiar with industry-related blogs and feeds.
* Must bend, reach, stretch for product as well as lift, carry and move at least 40 pounds | 18 kilos.
* Must regularly move around all store areas and be accessible to customers.


Before we wrap, a word about a few of our way cool perks…* Competitive base pay and bonus programs
* Flexible days and hours
* Amazing merchandise discounts
* 24/7 free confidential help with a variety of personal and work concerns
* Personal and professional development
* Giving back –volunteer program, disaster relief funds, charitable matching donations\\*
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, pet insurance, legal plan, ID theft, commuter benefit\\*
* Time Away – paid time off, holidays, parental leave, disability leave, bereavement\\*
* 401(k) plan with company matching contributions\\*

* Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to work location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.

At J.Crew Group (JCG) we aim to pay competitively for our company’s size and industry. The base salary offered will take into account internal equity and may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region of work premises, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The base salary is just one component of J.Crew Group’s competitive total rewards strategy that also includes the opportunity for bonus, competitive benefits and perks.

title: Maintenance Technician Full-Time
description:
**Ironstate Properties** is a premier full-service commercial real estate developer, owner, and manager of luxury apartments. We are actively looking for a highly skilled and detail-oriented **Maintenance Technician** to join our team in Harrison, NJ.


**This is a full-time position.**


**Rate: $21.00 - $25.00 per hour**


**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* Conducting routine inspections of premises and equipment. Performing preventative maintenance;
* Handling basic repairs such as repairing broken locks, filling gaps on walls etc.;
* Report to a facilities or maintenance manager for issues;
* Install appliances and equipment;
* Inspect and troubleshoot equipment and systems (e.g. ventilation);
* Check functionality of safety systems (e.g. fire alarm); and
* Collaborate with workers and other professionals during renovations.


**Required Skills:**


* Experience using hand and electrical tools
* Basic knowledge of plumbing, electrical and mechanical systems and ability to perform basic repairs on these systems
* Good communication and interpersonal skills


**What we offer to you** **available (upon eligibility):**


* 20 PTO days annually, which includes vacation and sick time (pro-ration based on hire date)
* 401(k) plan + employer match
* Medical, dental & vision coverage
* Employee referral incentive for successful hires


This job description is subject to change, in the sole discretion of the Company, and in no way creates an employment contract, implied or otherwise; each employee remains, at all times, an “at will” employee.


* **U.S. work authorization is required.**



We welcome applicants who are passionate about maintaining properties and providing excellent customer service. If you are a skilled Maintenance Technician looking for a new challenge, we encourage you to apply.

title: Shipping and Logistics Coordinator
description:
Shipping and Logistics Coordinator

We are an established and growing women’s apparel designer/manufacturer/wholesaler located in NYC who is looking for an experienced Shipping and Logistics Coordinator. The successful candidate will be detail oriented and able to accurately manage and process a high volume of outgoing shipments in an organized and efficient manner while maintaining an accurate inventory of incoming and outgoing merchandise. This person will be working in conjunction with a more senior individual to share in the responsibilities of the department.

Responsibilities Include

Inventory Management

* Tracking incoming containers of finished goods against what was purchased from our overseas vendors to identify potential overages/shortages
* Communicating with production department to keep informed on any goods that will potentially arrive late or early
* Keeping management and buyers aware of early/late deliveries of goods
* Logging in receipt of goods from containers into inventory
* Keeping an accurate ongoing inventory and monitoring aging across multiple warehouse locations
* Maintain and send weekly inventory reports to buyers and to management
* Working with management to ensure all inventory is sold at the end of the season
* Managing periodic physical inventory to verify accuracy with warehouses

Shipping and Logistics

* Monitor sales order delivery dates and cross reference against incoming shipments to ensure timely delivery
* Follow logistics routing guides to ensure that all guidelines are followed
* Send instructions to the warehouse to follow for pickups and deliveries to the customer
* Ensure Bill of Ladings match what was shipped and send to accounting for processing

Qualifications & Requirements

* A bachelor’s degree
* 2+ years of experience in the key responsibilities identified above
* Must be proficient in Excel - Quickbooks, A2000 a plus
* Ability to multitask and adhere to reporting deadlines
* Ability to work independently and as part of a small, focused management team
* Proactive approach to continuous improvement and process enhancement
* Experience in fashion industry a plus
* Experience with TJX routing guide a plus

Compensation

* $65000-75000 Salary
* Fully employer paid health insurance for an individual
* 401K
* Paid time off

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Emergency Department Registered Nurse - EDRN24-11988
description:
**Job Title:** Emergency Department Registered Nurse  

**Location:** Edison, NJ  

**Duration:** 3 Months


**Schedule:**



Hours Per Week: 36  

Hours Per Day: 12  

Days Per Week: 3  

Shift: 7:00 PM - 7:30 AM  

Weekend Requirement: Every other weekend  

Holiday Requirement: As needed  

No On-Call Requirement  

13-week assignment  

Float Requirements: Float within department - ED Adult, Peds, IMC


**Job Summary:**



The Registered Nurse (RN) in the Emergency Department (ED) is responsible for delivering critical care to patients in urgent and trauma situations. ED RNs must be equipped to handle a wide array of emergency scenarios, providing specialized care for patients of all ages. This role requires quick and accurate assessment of incoming patients, prioritizing their injuries and medical needs to deliver immediate, effective care. Strong experience with stroke, sepsis, and STEMI patients is essential, as well as the ability to work in a fast-paced, high-acuity environment.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Provide comprehensive nursing care in emergency situations, assessing and prioritizing patient needs swiftly and accurately.
* Develop and implement effective nursing care plans based on clinical knowledge and patient conditions.
* Communicate effectively with patients, families, and hospital personnel to ensure clear understanding of patient care.
* Perform a wide range of professional nursing services, adapting to the fast-paced and high-pressure environment of the ED.
* Manage care for patients with acute and complex conditions, including stroke, sepsis, and STEMI.
* Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


**Required Skills & Experience:**


* Minimum of 18 months of Nursing experience in an ED environment.
* Demonstrated performance and practice in an ED setting, with recent experience within the past six months.
* Strong experience managing care for stroke, sepsis, and STEMI patients.
* Ability to handle a fast-paced, high-acuity Emergency Department, with a patient volume that can reach up to 220 per day.


**Educational Requirements:**


**Required:**


* Current CPR Health Care Provider Certification.
* BLS - AHA.
* ACLS - AHA.
* NIHSS.
* PALS - AHA.
* New Jersey State Professional Registered Nurse license or multi-state compact license.


**Lang****uage Requirements:** Proficiency in English (speak, read, write).

title: Medical Assistant-Contract-24-10486
description:
**Title-**Medical Assistant-Contract-24-10486  

**Location-**New York,NY


**Job Summary:** We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Medical Assistant to join our healthcare team on a contract basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for supporting the healthcare team in providing high-quality patient care, ensuring smooth operations, and enhancing patient experiences.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* **Patient Interaction:**


	+ Greet and assist patients in a friendly and professional manner.
	+ Conduct initial patient assessments, including taking medical histories and vital signs.
* **Clinical Duties:**


	+ Prepare patients for examinations and assist healthcare providers during procedures.
	+ Administer medications and injections as directed by a physician or nurse.
	+ Perform basic laboratory tests and maintain lab equipment.
* **Administrative Tasks:**


	+ Manage patient records, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.
	+ Schedule appointments and coordinate follow-up care as needed.
	+ Assist with billing and coding procedures for insurance claims.
* **Communication:**


	+ Relay information between patients and healthcare providers effectively.
	+ Educate patients on treatment plans and medication instructions.
* **Compliance:**


	+ Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and standards.
	+ Maintain a clean and organized work environment.

**Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent; certification as a Medical Assistant preferred.
* Previous experience in a clinical setting is a plus.
* Knowledge of medical terminology, procedures, and relevant software.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced environment.


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to lift and move patients as needed.
* Prolonged periods of standing or walking.

title: Neonatal Intensive Care Unit Registered Nurse - NICURN24-12101
description:
**Job Title:** Neonatal Intensive Care Unit Registered Nurse  

**Location:** Hackensack, NJ 07601  

**Duration:** 3 Months


**Schedule:**



Hours Per Week: 36  

Hours Per Day: 12  

Days Per Week: 3  

Shift: 7:00 PM - 7:30 AM  

13-week assignment with every other weekend and holidays required. No on-call duties.


**Job Summary:**



The Registered Nurse (RN) in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) is responsible for delivering patient-centered care in a high-acuity environment. The RN evaluates patient needs, assists physicians, and provides comprehensive nursing care, from initial assessment through to discharge planning. The role involves developing and implementing individualized care plans based on thorough patient assessments, ensuring quality standards are met, and advocating for evidence-based practices.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Plan, implement, and document nursing care tailored to the needs of NICU patients.
* Assess patient needs, prioritize care, and adjust care plans based on ongoing evaluations.
* Perform therapeutic nursing interventions and manage the overall care of NICU patients.
* Document all aspects of care according to standards, patient acuity, and clinical priorities.
* Advocate for and support evidence-based practices and innovations in care delivery.
* Provide patient-centric care in alignment with professional nursing practice models.
* Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


**Required Skills & Experience:** Minimum of 1 year of experience in a NICU or related specialty.


**Educational Requirements:**



Required: Associate of Science in Nursing (ASN).  

Preferred: Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN).


**Certifications & Licensure:**


**Required:**


* Basic Life Support (BLS) - AHA.
* Neonatal Resuscitation Program (NRP) - AHA.
* New Jersey State Professional Registered Nurse license or multi-state compact license.


**Language Requirements:** Proficiency in English (speak, read, write).

title: Zone Director - Facilities
description:
The Bridges mission is to change lives, by offering help, hope, and opportunity to the most vulnerable in our community. We offer a comprehensive range of evidence-based rehabilitative services, including mental health and substance abuse treatment, housing, vocational training and job placement, healthcare, education, and creative arts therapies.

  

The Zone Director at The Bridge Inc./Weston United is responsible for comprehensive facility management across multiple locations throughout New York City. This includes overseeing all aspects of facilities management and preventive maintenance, supervising maintenance staff, managing housekeeping and security operations, and coordinating with outside vendors to ensure optimal facility performance and safety.

**Essential Position Functions:**

* Supervise maintenance staff and conduct daily cleanliness checks.
* Maintain inventory of supplies and prevent loss.
* Oversee set-up for over 800 annual events.
* Ensure all fire safety and CCTV equipment is functional and report issues.
* Conduct regular inspections of the buildings interior and exterior, including all systems and equipment.
* Develop and manage a preventive maintenance schedule for all systems and equipment.
* Maintain heating and hot water systems, and prepare for seasonal changes.
* Recommend repairs and replacements; ensure utility and emergency systems are operational.
* Respond to emergencies 24/7 and maintain building safety and cleanliness.
* Maintain and update security information at the desk.
* Review, prioritize, and assign work orders daily.
* Track and ensure timely completion of repairs, responding to tenants within 24 hours.
* Address and correct violations from governing agencies promptly.
* Report incidents immediately, serve on-call for emergencies, and attend required training.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* High school diploma or GED required; Associate degree preferred.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective interaction with internal and external customers.
* Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook).
* Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and maintain a positive attitude while providing exemplary customer service.
* Capable of working independently, completing assignments within given instructions, and adhering to standard practices.
* On-call availability for after-hours emergencies, ensuring timely resolution.
* Attend professional development trainings and study for required certifications.
* Bilingual in Spanish is a plus.

**The Bridge Inc. is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Billing and Credentialing Coordinator - Billing
description:
The Bridge is dedicated to transforming lives by providing help, hope, and opportunities to the most vulnerable individuals in our community. We deliver a comprehensive array of evidence-based rehabilitative services, which include mental health and substance abuse treatment, housing support, vocational training and job placement, healthcare, education, and creative arts therapies.


The Billing and Credentialing Coordinator plays a crucial role in managing the credentialing process for our agency providers. In addition to overseeing provider credentials, this position is responsible for handling billing tasks for designated programs.

**Essential Position Functions:**

* Process agency wide provider and agency enrollment, credentialing, and revalidation through CAQH.
* Manage payer-provider roster updates and practice information requests.
* Effectively manage clearinghouse claims issues.
* Manage Excess Income process for all billable programs.
* Analyze and report on accounts receivable.
* Research/Investigate/Resolve and communicate complex eligibility issues.
* Perform other tasks assigned by the supervisor.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* 3-5 years of experience in healthcare billing and credentialing
* Strong understanding of Managed Care Payer rules and Medicare LCD and NCCI Edits
* Familiarity with OMH and OASAS regulations and procedures
* Proficient in third-party payer, Medicaid, and Medicare billing and payment processes
* Experience with provider credentialing, Medicaid Excess Income, and not-for-profit behavioral health regulations
* Competent with computer systems, including knowledge of NYS ePaces/eMedNY and AWARDS, plus experience with clearinghouses

**The Bridge Inc. is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: CRPA Peer Specialist - Community Support Program
description:
The Bridges mission is to change lives, by offering help, hope, and opportunity to the most vulnerable in our community. We offer a comprehensive range of evidence-based rehabilitative services, including mental health and substance abuse treatment, housing, vocational training and job placement, healthcare, education, and creative arts therapies.  

  

Under the Program Director's guidance and in compliance with all relevant laws and agency policies, the CRPA Peer Specialist supports adults with substance use and mental health challenges. This role emphasizes respecting client rights, maintaining professional boundaries, and delivering clinical services aimed at helping clients achieve their recovery goals. Focused on the Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) communities, the Specialist will conduct outreach to current program participants and individuals in Upper Manhattan and the South Bronx, offering support to those engaged in high-risk drug-related behaviors.

 **Essential Position Functions:**

* Conduct outreach and locate target areas within the Upper Manhattan and South Bronx to conduct consistent outreach and Narcan training as well as Fentanyl test strip training.
* Building connections and partnerships with community resources and agencies.
* Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team to provide adults with person-centered peer support services related to substance use and/or mental health.
* Complete required documentation in a timely and high-quality manner.
* Work collaboratively with clients, their families, and community partners to assist clients in achieving their treatment and recovery goals.
* Coordinate client care through close involvement with hospitals, substance use treatment facilities, probation and parole, etc.
* Collaborate with the client in the creation of individualized service plans, and crisis/relapse prevention plans.
* Use evidence-based individual and group treatments in the areas of substance abuse and mental health to address client needs (WRAP, harm reduction, etc).
* Assist in connecting clients to address needs such as family support, housing, entitlements, employment, education, vocational interests, legal advocacy, community integration, and connection to physical health care, etc.
* Assist with providing psychoeducation on harem reduction and reducing high-risk behavior.
* Distribute harm reduction kits to individuals in need.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Certified Recovery Peer Advocate (CRPA) Certification is required.
* Bachelors degree in Human Services preferred.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English required; proficiency in Spanish is highly desired.
* Strong computer skills are needed.
* Lived experience in mental health, substance use, criminal justice, or homelessness is highly encouraged.
* Experience in conducting Narcan training is a plus.

**The Bridge Inc. is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Private Tutor
description:
Looking for someone that has experience with 8th grade-high school math (up to Calculus and Trigonometry). The tutor must also be reliable, energetic, organized, creative and enthusiastic about making learning fun.

Bachelor's degree and teaching/tutoring experience required. This is part time work and must be able to commit to at least 2 hours weekly until the end of the school year (typically school breaks are off).

We are a boutique tutoring company looking to hire tutors that specialize in private tutoring with children ranging from PreK-12th grade Manhattan and surrounding boroughs. We are always looking to hire more, but need to fill this one immediately.

More Specific Responsibilities:

title: Business Development Associate
description:
**EXCITING NEW ROLE AT OUR MORRISTOWN CORPORATE OFFICE**

**WORK IN ONE OF THE BEST CITIES TO LIVE IN THE UNITED STATES**

**SUMMARY DUTIES**


The **Business Development Associate** is responsible for identifying potential business growth opportunities for Villa Restaurant Group (VRG), primarily focusing on domestic restaurant airport opportunities. Reporting to the Director of Business Development, this position will also work closely with existing and potential business partners, Airport Concessions Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (ACDBE) partners, external stakeholders, and identify new business groups to work with VRG.

**ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES**

* The primary responsibility of this position is to establish and maintain our quality presence in the airport restaurant space and contribute toward the growth of our overall travel hospitality business. This individual must establish working relationships with brand partners, network with airport developers, Airport Concessions Disadvantaged Business Enterprise groups (ACDBE), and develop a deep understanding of these fields.
* This position will become familiar with upcoming Request for Proposal (RFP) releases; review and summarize key elements of RFPs; and participate in onsite tours. Additionally, they will assist with the support and preparation of RFPs, including managing outsourced firms, interacting with other departments to obtain information, find sustainable and charitable local community initiatives to get involved with, and explore Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiatives designed to develop community involvement and interest.
* To be effective, the Business Development Associate will transition into researching and connecting with local, regional, and national brands. Identify and develop relationships with strategic business partners and match with potential site opportunities.
* This individual will manage communications with joint venture partners and assist with obtaining documentation for filings, licenses, permits, coordinating meetings, and identifying new potential partners.
* This position will interact with the airport operations teams and manage the sublease required operational process: gather information for quarterly business status reports, transaction counts, gross sales, employee sales, year-end accounting reports, etc. for accuracy and timely reporting. In addition, they will be tasked with developing a checklist for each airport location to manage this process and other related procedures.
* Gain understanding and experience with government, lobbyists, airport authorities, and partnerships such as the Port Authority and Greater Orlando Airport Authority.
* Develop and sustain company relationships through market-facing activities such as active engagement in relevant industry organizations, professional associations, and conferences. Create a calendar of industry conferences, such as the International Council of Shopping Centers (ICSC), Airport Experience News (AXN), Airports Council International (ACI), and Airport Minority Advisory Council (AMAC).
* This individual will also maintain lease/franchise/license compliance reports, assist with lease administration needs, software upkeep, compile internal business data, and prepare lease summaries for new and renewing agreements.
* Working with the Business Development team, the Business Development Associate will update presentations, create new branding materials or proposals, email communications, lease information, paperwork, forming entities, etc.
* Grow awareness of the company brand and its services with existing and new relationships through meetings, presentations, business networking and business social events.
* Stay aware of current and longer-term market trends. Apply a thorough understanding of relevant industries to shape sales and business development strategies.

title: Food Runner/Server - Water Hazard Bar + Lounge
description:

At Chelsea Piers you will find colleagues who are passionate about what we do. Careers at Chelsea Piers offer unmatched facilities, excellent benefits, and proven career growth opportunities for people who are passionate about transforming the lives of our community through sports, fitness, and event experiences.

**About the Opportunity:**  

Chelsea Piers Golf Club is seeking to hire a part-time Food Runner/Server to join our Water Hazard Team. Located in the Chelsea Piers Golf Club lobby on Pier 59, the Water Hazard Bar + Lounge offers a variety of signature cocktails, draft beers, and seasonal small plates for everyone to enjoy. As the Food Runner/Server you will be expected to:

* Consistently greet all clients
* Keep abreast of all pertinent information: specials, events, programming etc.

* Effectively answer/resolve client inquiries through active listening and offering alternative options where applicable
* Monitor visitor access and maintain security awareness

This is not comprehensive list of responsibilities, which can change at any time at the discretion of your supervisor.


**About You:**

* Superior front line customer service skills
* A positive attitude and strong work ethic
* Willingness to take on other tasks
* Excellent oral communication skills
* Ability to occasionally lift up to 25 poundsor more

* Abilityto work on weeknights, weekends, and holidays

title: Assistant Gymnastics Manager - Field House
description:
**About Chelsea Piers:**  

At Chelsea Piers you will find colleagues who are passionate about what we do. Careers at Chelsea Piers offer unmatched facilities and proven career growth opportunities for people who are passionate about transforming the lives of our community through sports, fitness, and event experiences. We also offer excellent benefits, including medical, dental, and vision insurance; 401(k) matching; paid time off; transportation benefits; tuition assistance; a complimentary membership to Chelsea Piers Fitness; and other exciting venue benefits at Chelsea Piers.

**About the Opportunity:**  

Chelsea Piers is seeking to hire an Assistant Gymnastics Manager to join our Gymnastics Department at Field House Chelsea. In this role, you will be responsible for coordinating the logistics of our competitive gymnastics teams and supporting the department with a variety of office operations and administrative work. This role reports to the Director of Gymnastics and works closely with Gymnastics Team Directors, coaches, the registration office, and customers. This position requires you to be in the office every day: Tuesday - Saturday from September to June and Monday - Friday for July and August.


As the Assistant Gymnastics Manager, you will be expected to:

**Team Management:**

* Create team meet schedules with Team Directors and send schedules to families
* Communicate with host gyms ahead of meets for all planning and logistics (identify travel logistics, confirm registration procedures, etc.)
* Research and book all meet travel needs (flight/car and hotel) and maintain organized spreadsheet of all costs and dates
* Manage successful meet registration process between host gym and Field House Controller
* Maintain proactive, clear, consistent communication with all team families regarding fees, practice schedules, meet schedules, parent Zoom meetings (as requested by Head Coaches)
* Coordinate uniform orders for all team athletes
* Directly address any minor questions or complaints regarding logistics (practice times, meet fees, meet schedule) in a professional and timely manner
* Appropriately manage-up any other complaints to Head Coaches to handle immediately
* Complete team practice schedules for review and approval in timely manner
* Create registration welcome emails for all team families prior to fall season
* Develop and clearly communicate rotations for all rec coaches/classes
* Create annual calendar for professional development training for all team coaches and ensure successful completion of training sessions
* Communicate and post rotations for Gymnastics Program
* Charge all entry fees for Meets or anything else in real time
* Manage Team expenses

**Administrative Work:**

* Create weekly payroll forms and distribute to hourly employees and enter payroll data
* Monitor candidate pipeline and create and execute standardized onboarding for all new coaches
* Work directly with Controller to determine best process for expense reimbursements and ensure expense reimbursements for Gymnastics coaches are all completed in a timely fashion
* Manage Summer Gymnastics Classes & assist with School Break camps
	+ This includes staffing, rotations, ratios etc..
* Ensure all meet payments are collected from families in full and on-time
* Monitor and respond to all voicemails and emails in a timely fashion

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* Work as Manager on Duty and dedicate ample time on a weekly basis to being present and overseeing gymnastics area
* Create and maintain annual calendar of social events for all team levels and share calendar in advance of fall season with all team families
* Maintain positive and informative channel of communication with team families via TeamSnap and ensure all participants are up to date with active families
* Monitor all Team Snap activity for gymnastics
* Create content and post to Gymnastics Team social media

**About You:**  

You are professional, dependable, energetic, and are passionate about gymnastics and working with children and families. You are detail-oriented and have excellent communication and customer service skills and can work collaboratively with management, coaches, and parents. You also have:

* Strong organization skills and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously
* Ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision
* Ability to anticipate issues and take initiative to problem solve
* Up to date USA Gymnastics Safety Certification & SafeSport Certifications
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds or more
* Ability to be standing or moving for multiple hours
* Ability to see and hear athletes clearly in a busy environment
* Knowledge and enthusiasm for gymnastics, preferred.

title: Counter Sales Representative
description:
Unilock, North America's premier manufacturer of concrete paving stones and retaining walls for over 50 years is **currently seeking a Counter Sales Representative with forklift experience at our Chester, NY Yard.**



This position calls for a bright, motivated Sales Representative who thrives amidst the challenges of a fast-paced environment and possesses an urgency in customer service. You will have the opportunity to bring your energy to a high-performing team, working collaboratively with both our office and yard team members.


**What you'll do**


* Answering of telephones and satisfying customer requests with a friendly demeanor, and willingness to help at all times
* Support retail customers and contractors with their purchases, via design assistance (calculating square footage required), order entry and any future inquiries that arise
* Retrieve hand-selected product samples from designated sample area and loading into requesting customers vehicles
* Process all, check and credit card transactions and reconcile payments received
* Load and confirm orders for invoice processing and posting
* Perform random tractor-trailer checks to ensure load accuracy before delivery
* Operate an industrial forklift, to assist yard personnel loading trucks SAFELY, promptly and accurately according to shipping documents using an e-tablet
* Participate in and assist with cycle counting throughout the year, as well as yearly full yard counts


**What you need to succeed**


* Exceptional customer service skills, with attention to detail and accuracy
* Must have sound problem solving skills to effectively handle customer objections and questions
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, and basic skills using an e-tablet
* Ability to manage competing priorities, work with strict deadlines, address projects, and work processes
* Must have at least 1 year of forklift experience and ability to pass Unilock licensing test.
* Experience with a 5k -10k pound exterior forklift is a plus
* Ability to read & comprehend all shipping related documents, and perform basic math equations
* Ability to distinguish product colors, color blends, and product bundle configurations
* Requires standing, stooping, reaching, and lifting to 30 lbs.
* Collaborative individual with a strong, self-directed work ethic in a fast past environment
* Professional and courteous behavior with a cheerful outlook in ALL situations.
* Requires consistent and dependable attendance


**Why Join Unilock** **-** Our core philosophy as a family-owned and operated company puts family first. That’s why we think it’s so important to have a safe and inclusive workplace where you can make a difference and build a long-term career. You would be joining a team that values health and safety, integrity, diversity, growth and internal promotions


* Health Benefits -first of the month following your hire date
* Vacation – Earn up to (2) Weeks first year
* Companywide paid holiday closure between Christmas and New Year’s Day
* Paid Leave Days – 48 hours per year
* Semi-annual performance incentives and year end Company bonuses
* 401K Matching, Profit Sharing, Life Insurance, Health Savings accounts
* Reimbursements -Tuition, Gym Memberships, Wellness Programs and SO MUCH MORE!

#### **Education**


Required* High School or better


Preferred* High School or better

#### **Skills**


Preferred* Customer Service
* Problem Solving
